body.name: Apevia JUPITER800W Jupiter 800W 80 Plus Bronze Certified Active PFC ATX Gaming Power Supply, Supports Dual/Quad Core CPUs, SLI/Crossfire/Haswell

features: Apevia JUPITER800W Jupiter 800W 80 Plus Bronze certified active PFC ATX Gaming power supply.
Connectors: 1 x 20/24pin main power, 1 x p8(4+4p) esp 12V, 4 x SATA + 4 x 8(6+2)pin PCI-E, 4 x peripheral, 1 x floppy. Supports single 12V output for higher power usage
Supports ATX 12V 2. 3 Version. Supports Dual/Quad Core CPUs. Supports SLI/Crossfire/ Haswell. All sleeved cables.
Double forward converter design. Heavy duty protections: Short-circuit/ over-voltage/ over-power/ under-voltage protections
body.description: Apevia Jupiter series power supply is 80 Plus Bronze certified. It offers spellbinding performance for high-end PC gaming rigs and extreme systems that demand the most reliable and efficient energy source. This versatile PS supports NVidia SLI, as well as ATI crossfire and Haswell. The Jupiter series is also ideal for dual and quad core CPUs. The thermally controlled automatic sensor regulates fan speed while reducing noise. And a powerful 135mm black fan delivers outstanding ventilation.• Model No.: JUPITER800W • Max. Power : 800W • Material : Metal • Color : Black • Switches : Additional Power Switch 115/230 Volt Selector Switch (1)Product Features: • 80 Plus Bronze Certified • Universal AC Input by Active PFC (99% PF Typical) • Cosmic Black Casing • Supports Single 12V Output for Higher Power Usage • Supports ATX 12V 2.3 Version • Supports Dual/Quad Core CPUs • Supports SLI, Crossfire & Haswell • Automatic Thermally Controlled 135mm Black Fan • All Cables are Sleeved • Heavy Duty Protections Including OVP (Over Voltage Protection), OPP (Over Power Protection), UVP (Under Voltage Protection) and SCP (Short Circuit Protection) • Double Forward Converter Design (2) Connectors • 1 x 20/24pin Main Power • 4 x 8(6+2)Pin PCI Express • 1 x P8(4+4P) ESP 12V • 4 x 4Pin Peripheral • 4 x Serial ATA • 1 x Floppy (3) Input • Voltage Ranges:115V/230V • Input Freguency:60Hz/50Hz (4)Output • +3.3V@20A, +5V@20A, +12V@58A, -12V@0.3A, +5Vsb@2.5A (5) Operating Temperature: The Power Supply Should be Operated in an Ambient Temperature of 0°C to 40°C (6) Overall Performance: • Total Output Power: Full Load at Normal Line Input Voltage. • Hold up Time: 17ms at Full Load normal Line Input Voltage. • Switching Frequency: 50KHz at Normal Line Input. For safety, do not overload, abuse or modify the power supply unit. Use of this unit for Bitcoin Mining is not suggested since it will shorten the life and cause failures of power supply. Use for mining purposes is not covered by warranty.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.3 4.3 out of 5 stars 37 ratings 4.3 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far an excellent PSU for the money.
reviews.reviewText: This PSU is performing better than I had hoped. With all the people online pooping all over Apevia PSUs I was leary, but I'm happy to say that it is working wonderfully. I had a Thermaltake PSU in my system that should have been able to handle the configuration of my computer, but I found out after installing the Apevia PSU that the Thermaltake was junk. Most of the fans in my system were not reaching the full rating of 2000rpm. I installed the Apevia and all my fans are now at their full speed and the volt readings in the BIOS are all were they should be now. I don't know what other people are doing to make these PSUs fail. The only thing I can think of is some people are mixing up the cpu power with the pci-e power and borking things. So, so far all is well and computing along as they should be. If this changes I will update but right now all is well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Power supply works well but cooling fan failed within 2 weeks.
reviews.reviewText: The power supply works as advertised, no issues powering the upgrades I made to my PC. I have a slightly built HP Z210 and had to buy an adapter cable to for the main connector to mate with my motherboard. I researched this ahead of time and knew that going in so no issue. The connector I bought also worked well with no issues. The power supply did not mount in the PC case properly so I had to make some modifications, drill some holes, and make a couple small brackets in order to install it. This might be challenging for someone who is not handy with those sorts of things, so keep this in mind if you are buying one for the PC case I mentioned.The only issue I have had thus far, after a couple months of use is that the main 5" cooling fan failed within 2 weeks. The fan blade assembly melted off the shaft and after some banging, clanging, and some burning smells, the fan no longer functions. I had to remove it and replace it. I examined it and cannot find any reason why it would have melted the way it did, but the fan blades are completely detached from the brushless motor. I would expect it to last longer than two weeks. 3 stars because the power supply is still working as it should, the fan is just garbage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great and so far no issues.
reviews.reviewText: Very very surprised at the performance and cost. Was very hesitant to buy this after my expensive coolmax starting making humming noise and saw this just searching around for certified psu and based in review took a chance and it worked great... Of course down side is that it's not modular but I put it in full tower (plenty of space to hide wires) I wish they do offer modular psu in the future for similar price structure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Payed for what I got...it works and didn't mess up my pc but has a weird static noise coming from there speacilly when in load. Got scared it was going to implode so I opt to get a corsair and keep this as back up or for my kids pc.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: es una de las fuentes mas económicas con certificado que he encontrado en el mercado, hasta ahora me ha dado un rendimiento increible, tanto que confio todo mi pc en el cual hago streaming a esta fuente.
